sentences.sentence: NATO allies joined in the outrage, some calling it barbaric. At least 17 people, including a child, were killed and a further 32 wounded in what's been one of Russia's deadliest missile strikes in months.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Romania has finally admitted it found possible drone debris on its territory two days after Ukraine said a Russian drone had detonated on the NATO member's land.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Romanian officials had earlier denied reports of drones falling inside the country and said Russian attacks in neighboring Ukraine did not cause a direct threat.

sentences.sentence: Romania's Defense Minister, Angel Tilva, has been to the area and said an investigation was needed after debris was discovered in an area of the Danube that forms a natural border between Romania and war-torn Ukraine. In the meantime, Romanian troops remain on alert in the area for any overspill of the conflict in Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Κόποι μιας ζωής, κόποι γενναιών έγιναν στάχτη μέσα σε λίγες ώρες. Υπότιτλοι AUTHORWAVE The 10th edition of the Rugby World Cup is about to kick off with France hosting New Zealand in Paris on Friday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: The tournament features 20 teams and the winners will be crowned at the Stade de France on

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: October 28th.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: In the history of the World Cup, only four countries, New Zealand, Australia, South Africa and England have gone all the way.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: However this year South African player Duane Vermeulen believes it will be more open.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: I think this year's World Cup is probably the most open World Cup that you can have.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: So everyone talked about the French team and some guys talked about New Zealand, some guys will talk about Scotland and some guys will talk about South Africa.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: This year is just, it is so open and everyone needs to, who plays needs to take the opportunity and hopefully we'll see, you know see who makes it to the final.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: South Africa are the defending champions and are just behind Ireland in the world rankings with Libla currently sitting third.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: Matches will take place in nine host cities across France and the sports minister has said the country has learnt lessons from the 2022 Champions League final held in Paris.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: In February, an independent panel of experts exonerated Liverpool supporters and pointed fingers at UEFA and French authorities for the near-mass fatality catastrophe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: In response, French Interior Minister Gérard Darmanin said more than 5,100 police forces will be mobilised every matchday during the tournament and up to 7,500 at peak times.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: According to reports, some 600,000 foreign visitors and 2 million spectators are expected to attend the competition.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: France and New Zealand will be the first teams bidding to ignite the passion of rugby fans on Friday evening, whilst the likes of Italy, Ireland and England will all be in action on Saturday.
